text:
How many 120x60 tiles are 31970 m2

To calculate how many 120x60 tiles you need to cover an area of 31970 square meters, follow these steps:

1. Calculate the area of one tile:
\[ \text{Area of one tile} = 120 \text{ cm} \times 60 \text{ cm} \]

Since the area is given in square meters (m²), we need to convert centimeters to meters first:
\[ 120 \text{ cm} = 1.2 \text{ m} \]
\[ 60 \text{ cm} = 0.6 \text{ m} \]

Now, calculate the area of one tile in square meters:
\[ \text{Area of one tile} = 1.2 \text{ m} \times 0.6 \text{ m} = 0.72 \text{ m}^2 \]

2. Divide the total area to be covered by the area of one tile to find out how many tiles are needed:
\[ \text{Number of tiles} = \frac{\text{Total area}}{\text{Area of one tile}} \]
\[ \text{Number of tiles} = \frac{31970 \text{ m}^2}{0.72 \text{ m}^2} \]

Perform the division:
\[ \text{Number of tiles} \approx 44,069.44 \]

Since you can't have a fraction of a tile, you would need to round up to the nearest whole number:

\[ \text{Number of tiles} = 44,070 \]

So, you would need approximately **44,070** tiles to cover an area of 31970 square meters.
